content.subtitle: About Me
content.headline: Bridging Software and Hardware
introduction: I'm Hamim Reja, a passionate Electronics and Communication Engineering undergraduate at Aliah University, Kolkata, with a strong focus on full-stack web development and AI systems. Currently in my final year with a CGPA of 7.68, I've cultivated expertise in building scalable MERN applications and deploying edge AI solutions.

My journey began with a fascination for how software and hardware interact. This led me to develop projects ranging from healthcare appointment platforms to AI-powered assistive devices for the visually impaired. I believe in leveraging technology to solve real-world problems, especially in healthcare and accessibility.

Beyond academics, I've gained practical experience through my internship with Indian Railways, where I worked with mission-critical signaling systems. When I'm not coding, I enjoy exploring new technologies, contributing to open-source projects, and continuously learning about the latest advancements in AI and web development.

content.subtitle: My Work
content.title: Portfolio
content.description: A collection of projects showcasing my expertise in full-stack development, AI systems, and hardware design. Each project represents a unique challenge and innovative solution.

projects.title: AI Smart Glasses for Visually Impaired
projects.shortDescription: Assistive wearable device with real-time object detection and face recognition for environment perception.
projects.fullDescription: Developed an innovative assistive wearable device designed to help visually impaired individuals navigate their environment safely. The system uses Ultralytics YOLOv10 for real-time object detection and obstacle avoidance, integrated with OpenCV's DNN module for face recognition capabilities. When a familiar face is detected, the system announces the person's name through a text-to-speech audio interface delivered via headphones. The entire solution is optimized to run on resource-constrained Raspberry Pi Zero 2W hardware, ensuring low-latency processing critical for user safety during navigation.

challenges.solution: Optimized Python scripts and model inference to achieve real-time performance on Pi Zero 2W through quantization and efficient memory management.

challenges.challenge: Accurate Face Recognition in Various Lighting
challenges.solution: Implemented preprocessing techniques and used robust DNN models that maintain accuracy across different environmental conditions.
Employed efficient algorithms and multi-threading to ensure detection and audio feedback occur within acceptable time frames.

impact: Provides independence for visually impaired users
Demonstrates practical application of edge AI

projects.title: Tuition & University Management System
projects.shortDescription: Role-based educational platform with custom 3-tier RBAC, automated fee management, and data visualization.
projects.fullDescription: Engineered a comprehensive role-based educational management platform featuring a sophisticated custom 3-tier Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) system. The permission hierarchy includes Superadmins who manage complete account lifecycles (activation/deactivation), Admins who handle department records and student management, and Students who have read-only dashboard access. The system implements automated fee management and payment tracking with intuitive data visualization for administrative oversight. A critical security feature includes automated triggers that instantly revoke JWT session tokens upon account deactivation by higher authorities, ensuring immediate access control.
features: Instant JWT token revocation on deactivation

challenges.solution: Designed a flexible RBAC middleware system that checks permissions at multiple levels and cascades properly through the hierarchy.
Implemented a token blacklist mechanism with Redis caching to ensure immediate session termination across all active devices.
Used MongoDB aggregation pipelines to pre-process data server-side and implemented efficient charting with lazy loading.

impact: Enhances security with granular access control

projects.title: MediQ â€“ Healthcare Appointment Platform
projects.shortDescription: Comprehensive healthcare ecosystem connecting doctors and patients with real-time scheduling and advanced search.
projects.fullDescription: Built a comprehensive bridging platform for doctors and patients featuring sophisticated real-time scheduling logic and advanced search algorithms. The system employs MongoDB Aggregation pipelines to enable multi-criteria filtering based on specialization, location, and availability. Implemented secure REST APIs with cookie-based JWT authentication for both patient and doctor portals. The platform includes modular React components for doctor slot management, allowing physicians to define their availability schedules dynamically. Patients can search, filter, and book appointments seamlessly while receiving real-time confirmations and reminders.
features: Advanced doctor search with multi-criteria filtering

challenges.solution: Leveraged MongoDB Aggregation pipelines with proper indexing to handle multi-criteria searches efficiently even with large datasets.
Implemented optimistic locking and transaction handling to prevent double-booking and ensure data consistency.
Designed modular components and RESTful APIs that can scale horizontally as the user base grows.

projects.title: ADC Interface using SPI on FPGA
projects.shortDescription: 14-bit ADC interfaced with Spartan-3E FPGA using SPI protocol for reliable data acquisition.
projects.fullDescription: Designed and implemented a hardware interface between a 14-bit Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) and a Spartan-3E FPGA using the Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) protocol. The project involved creating custom Verilog modules for clock division, SPI master controller, and data acquisition logic. Comprehensive timing analysis and simulation were performed to verify synchronization and ensure reliable data transfer. The design included proper handling of SPI timing requirements, chip select signals, and data framing to achieve accurate analog signal digitization.

challenges.solution: Carefully designed state machines and clock dividers to meet ADC timing requirements while maintaining FPGA clock domain stability.
Implemented proper synchronizers and metastability resolution techniques to ensure reliable data capture across clock domains.
Created comprehensive testbenches with multiple test scenarios to validate all operational modes and edge cases.

impact: Provides reusable SPI master IP core

projects.title: UART Protocol Implementation
projects.shortDescription: Complete UART transmitter and receiver with configurable baud rates and comprehensive verification.
projects.fullDescription: Designed a complete Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter (UART) communication system in Verilog, including both transmitter and receiver modules. The implementation supports configurable baud rates and includes proper start bit detection, data framing with configurable data bits, optional parity checking, and stop bit generation. Extensive testbench-driven validation was performed using Modelsim to verify functionality across different baud rates and data configurations. The design is synthesizable and optimized for FPGA deployment using Xilinx Vivado.
features: FIFO buffers for transmit and receive

challenges.solution: Implemented precise clock divider with minimal error accumulation to maintain accurate baud rates across different system clocks.
Used oversampling technique (16x) with majority voting to reliably detect start bits even in noisy environments.
Created detailed timing diagrams and simulation waveforms to verify all timing requirements and edge cases.
